review: Very nice and easy set-up out of the box. I was able to watch three episodes of Key and Peele without any issues. However, once I switched over to Penn and Teller's BS, the video would freeze at 0:00 and wouldn't resume no matter what. Very disappointed with it's performance. Hopefully it's just an Amazon prime issue but that still doesn't give me any confidence about this device. Back to Chromecast for me.Edit: I ended up rebooting the device a few times and that ended up fixing it. Not sure why it refused to play any videos because the internet was still working and navigating the video catalog properly.
author: Jason Stade

review: If you have a Prime subscription, this is a no-brainer.  I did get it at the special $19 price, but it's worth retail.  We love tv, but couldn't justify the satellite bill anymore, so we cut the cord a few months ago.  We have an HD antenna, already had Prime, added a Hulu subscription, and bought a Roku stick.  With three tv's in the house, and one of them being a smart tv, we hadn't planned on buying anything else.  In the meantime, we realized our "smart" tv freezes up enough to be annoying so we usually wind up plugging the roku into it and just move it around to whatever TV is most convenient.  When this deal came up, we jumped at it - now I wish I'd bought the limit of two so I could keep it on the smart tv and not bother with the built in tv apps.  I love the home screen on this better than the roku as it already immerses you in Prime instead of a generic home.  I haven't really tried many other features/apps/games as Prime and Hulu meet our needs.  There is also little delay in pausing/unpausing and play continues while you rewind or fast forward.  While we have no complains with the Roku, we now would choose the fire stick over it.
